intro: Centaurea sphaerocephala, commonly known as the globe thistle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its spherical, blue to purple flower heads that resemble a globe, surrounded by spiny bracts. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, gray-green leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. The flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
